meanings.definition: To remove the bark from a tree or plant.
meanings.sent1: I carefully unbark the tree to protect it from pests.
meanings.sent2: The gardener will unbark the young saplings to help them grow better.
meanings.sent3: Trying to unbark a cactus would be quite a prickly situation!
meanings.sent4: She had to unbark the tree of its protective layer to save it from disease.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the axe as I unbark the tree echoes through the forest.

meanings.definition: To disembark from a vehicle or vessel.
meanings.sent1: Passengers unbark from the cruise ship excitedly, ready to explore the island.
meanings.sent2: The travelers will unbark from the train at the next station.
meanings.sent3: The astronauts had to unbark from the spacecraft carefully to avoid floating away.
meanings.sent4: As the plane landed, the passengers began to unbark, eager to stretch their legs.
meanings.sent5: The crew members unbark from the submarine, grateful for fresh air after weeks underwater.
